text: a child called Fatima she lives in a
country Yemen where two-thirds of the
population need food aid and seven
million are hungry the United Nations
has been told the famine across four
countries is now the biggest crisis for
the organization since it was founded in
1945 we stand at a critical point in our
history already at the beginning of the
year we are facing the largest
humanitarian crisis is the creation of
the United Nations now more than 20
million people across four countries
face starvation and famine in South
Sudan more than a million children are
acutely malnourished and there's also a
cholera outbreak to deal with the UN
says that billions of dollars is needed
from the international community to feed
the hungry but so far only a fraction of
that money has got through the overall
requirement for South Sudan this year
stands at 1.6 billion u.s. dollars as of
now we have received 9.3 percent of that
amount and more funding is Oda Lee
needed some food aid is being delivered
the United Nations says famine can be
averted but the world needs to dig deep
into its pockets right now andy moore
BBC news
